column4: I have a TV Card which uses the bt878 thing, and I've installer tvtime, yet no matter where I have the arial/direction, tvtime keeps with the no signal - UK
oooh, tv cards are fun
card modules set up correctly?  Getting the "tuner" module right is especially tricky.  In my experience, the autodetect is unreliable
I have no idea :P - how can I tell :D
well, errm, at the risk of looking ignorant, trial and error worked for me.  There's documentation somewhere, lemme see if I can find it
if you rebooted recently, in /var/log/messages, or in maybe even in "dmesg", there should be a line containing "kernel: bttv0: using tuner=xx", or something the like
last reboot was last Sunday when I installed
familiar with linux (or UN*Xs in general?)
I know a fair amount - installed gentoo numerous times successfully etc.
mmkay.  Any lines like what I have above in your dmesg buffer, or in your system log?
be sure to use pastebin or the like for anything more than 1 line, or 'ware the wrath of ubotu
looks like the bttv initialization has scrolled out of the main log.  How bout trying "zgrep bttv /var/log/messages*"
did it get your card right?  i.e. Happauge WinTV?
yep
assuming that you've told TVtime that you're tuning PAL (as opposed to NTSC), you might try some different tuners.  /usr/src/linux/Documentation/video4linux/CARDLIST.tuner has a list of numbers
I'd suggest rmmod'ing "bttv" and "tuner" and then "modprobe bttv tuner=#", where # is one of the pal tuners listed.  Then see if tvtime starts working
/usr/src/linux/Documentation/video4linux/CARDLIST.tuner doesn't exist
http://giggsey.pastebin.com/609467
Not sure about this, but the TV Channels in the UK are between 20 and 35, yet tvtime doesn't let me go below 39 (it jumps straight to 1 from there (going down))
I'll admit I know nothing about PAL or UK television.  If changing the tuner doesn't help, it might be worth trying to use a simpler tv program to start.  Like xawtv

another thought, if your're still here: tvtime may have determined that the first few channels have nothing in them (e.g. because of a faulty tuner number, bad reception, whatever).  There's a channel tuning editor in there somewhere that you can override its decisions from
